intro: Amyema mosea, commonly known as the dwarf milkwood tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, milky sap. Amyema mosea is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
